Class Shell

mz.Shell

Direct Known Subclasses:
IntroShell
public class Shell extends Insertion
Shell Sort is an efficient sorting algorithm that is an extension of Insertion Sort. It addresses one of the limitations of Insertion Sort, which is the excessive shifting of elements when dealing with small elements towards the end of the array.
Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Shell

      public Shell()
      Shell Sort:
      Is an efficient sorting algorithm that is an extension of Insertion Sort. It addresses one of the limitations of Insertion Sort, which is the excessive shifting of elements when dealing with small elements towards the end of the array.

      Example:
      1. Start with an unsorted array of elements.
      2. Choose a gap sequence, which is a series of decreasing integers. Common gap sequences include the Knuth sequence (3^k - 1) / 2and the Sedgewick sequence (4^k + 3 * 2^(k-1) + 1).
      3. Iterate over the gap sequence, performing Insertion Sort on each subarray with the chosen gap.
      4. For each gap, divide the array into multiple subarrays, where the elements in each subarray are at a distance of the gap.
      5. Apply Insertion Sort to each subarray independently.
      6. Decrease the gap and repeat steps 4-5 until the gap becomes 1.
      7. Finally, apply Insertion Sort with a gap of 1 to sort the array completely.
      Note:
      The key idea behind Shell Sort is to sort the array in a way that allows for efficient shifting of elements across larger gaps. By sorting the array in stages using different gap sizes, Shell Sort gradually reduces the amount of shifting needed, leading to a more efficient sorting process.

      Shell Sort has a time complexity that depends on the chosen gap sequence. It can have an average-case time complexity of O(n log(n)^2) or better, which makes it faster than simple quadratic sorting algorithms like Insertion Sort or Selection Sort.

      Shell Sort is an in-place algorithm, meaning it does not require additional memory beyond the original array. It is widely used for medium-sized arrays or as a sub-routine in more advanced sorting algorithms.

      Property:
      Worst Case Complexity: O(n^2)
      Best Case Complexity: O(n log(n))
      Average Case Complexity: O(n log(n)^2)
      Auxiliary Space: O(1)
      Stability: No
      See Also:
      • IntroDPQShell
      • IntroShell

      Parameters:

    • shellInc

      protected void shellInc(Comparable[] array)
      shellInc that performs the Shell Sort algorithm on an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in ascending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and performs the Shell Sort algorithm on it.
      • The method uses a for loop to iterate over a series of decreasing values of i, which represents the gap between elements to be compared and swapped.
        • The initial value of i is set to half the length of the array: (array.length / 2).
        • In each iteration of the loop, the value of i is divided by 2: i /= 2.
        • The loop continues as long as i is greater than 0.
      • Inside the loop, the insertionInc method is called with the current value of i to perform an insertion sort on the array.
        • The insertionInc method sorts a portion of the array using the Insertion Sort algorithm with the specified i value.
        • The insertion sort is performed on elements that are i positions apart.
      • The process continues with decreasing values of i until i becomes 0, at which point the array is sorted.
      shellInc method implements the Shell Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in ascending order. It performs insertion sort on different portions of the array with decreasing gaps i until the entire array is sorted.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      See Also:
      • InsertionInterface.insertionInc(Comparable[], int, int)

    • shellDec

      protected void shellDec(Comparable[] array)
      shellDec that performs the Shell Sort algorithm on an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in descending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and performs the Shell Sort algorithm on it.
      • The method uses a for loop to iterate over a series of decreasing values of i, which represents the gap between elements to be compared and swapped.
        • The initial value of i is set to half the length of the array: (array.length / 2).
        • In each iteration of the loop, the value of i is divided by 2: i /= 2.
        • The loop continues as long as i is greater than 0.
      • Inside the loop, the insertionDec method is called with the current value of i to perform an insertion sort on the array.
        • The insertionDec method sorts a portion of the array using the Insertion Sort algorithm with the specified i value.
        • The insertion sort is performed on elements that are i positions apart.
      • The process continues with decreasing values of i until i becomes 0, at which point the array is sorted.
      shellDec method implements the Shell Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in ascending order. It performs insertion sort on different portions of the array with decreasing gaps i until the entire array is sorted.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      See Also:
      • InsertionInterface.insertionDec(Comparable[], int, int)

    • shellInc

      protected void shellInc(Comparable[] array, int left, int right)
      shellInc that performs the Shell Sort algorithm on an array of Comparable objects. The sorting is done in ascending order.
      • The method takes in an array of Comparable objects, array, and performs the Shell Sort algorithm on it.
      • The method uses a for loop to iterate over a series of decreasing values of i, which represents the gap between elements to be compared and swapped.
        • The initial value of i is set to half the length of the array: (array.length / 2).
        • In each iteration of the loop, the value of i is divided by 2: i /= 2.
        • The loop continues as long as i is greater than 0.
      • Inside the loop, the insertionInc method is called with the current value of i to perform an insertion sort on the array.
        • The insertionInc method sorts a portion of the array using the Insertion Sort algorithm with the specified i value.
        • The insertion sort is performed on elements that are i positions apart.
      • The process continues with decreasing values of i until i becomes 0, at which point the array is sorted.
      shellInc method implements the Shell Sort algorithm to sort the given array of Comparable objects in ascending order. It performs insertion sort on different portions of the array with decreasing gaps i until the entire array is sorted.
      Parameters:
      array - to be arranged.
      left - The starting index of the subarray to be sorted.
      right - The ending index (exclusive) of the subarray to be sorted.
      See Also:
      • InsertionInterface.insertionInc(Comparable[], int, int)

        • The insertion sort is performed on elements that are i positions apart.
      • The process continues with decreasing values of i until i becomes 0, at which point the array is sorted.
